derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French déployer, from Latin displicare and late Latin deplicare 'unfold or explain', from dis-, de- 'un-' + plicare 'to fold'. 比较 display

entry.tran: 部署，调集（部队或军事力量）
entry.def: To deploy troops or military resources means to organize or position them so that they are ready to be used.

example.ex: The president said he had no intention of deploying ground troops.
example.tran: 总统称并不打算部署地面部队。

example.ex: ...the US-made Patriot anti-missile system which was deployed in the Gulf war.
example.tran: 在海湾战争中部署的美国制造的“爱国者”反导弹系统

means.word_mean: 1. place troops or weapons in battle formation
